etymology.description: Ideogrammic compound (會意/会意): 厂 + 𣏟 — a representation of hemp leaves.
etymology.interpretation: A ‘cliff/shelter’ element (厂) placed over clustered leaves/wood (𣏟, akin to 林) depicts bunches of hemp hung up to dry. From the plant sense, it extended metaphorically to the feeling of numbness or tingling.

examples.chinese: 我手指麻了(我手指麻了)。
这条麻绳很结实(這條麻繩很結實)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo má shéng hěn jiéshi.
examples.english: This hemp rope is very sturdy.

examples.chinese: 这种布是麻做的(這種布是麻做的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng bù shì má zuò de.
examples.english: This cloth is made of hemp.
